Description: Pottery jar imitating the Phoenician Bichrome Ware; spherical body on a ring base; single handle; neck (top lost); reddish-brown clay with dark grey core; pale yellow slip, decorated with dark brown and red paint; vertical concentric circles on the sides, with intersecting lines on the front part of shoulder; horizontal band below the lower edge of handle; re-assembled from fragments.
Curator's comments: See Brissaud and Zivie-Coche - Tanis 1987-1997, (1998) p.117, 139, [pl.7a].
